message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with the problem of detecting abusive language on social media platforms. The use of neural networks for this task also suggests that it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also addresses the issue of deliberate obfuscation of words, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the use of datasets from Twitter and Wikipedia talk page suggests that it could also belong to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
